summary:
Since 2017 living in DR Congo again. There I have been volunteering in humanitarian aid projects. Ianuary 2019 togethter with my husband Roelof van Til we founded our own organisation, the 4 Pillars. We are developiong an agricultural system which protects and improves the soil and seed quality. The goal is to help the poorest of the poor to improve their incomes and to save the forest.
We live in North East Congo among the population and together with them we are refining this new agricultural appraoch. More information can be found on our website: www.4pillars.nl

From 2008-2017 I have been working as an NT-2 trainer (Teaching Dutch as a Second Language) in various integration programmes . I have been training people from many different countries on various levels many of whom passed their ‘Inburgeringsexamen’ at level A2 in the CEF (Common European Framework of Reference) Additionally, I have trained people for the Dutch State exam NT2 (CEF level B1-B2)  and I have trained literacy groups.
Since September 2012 I also teach care and welfare lessons at a vocational institution.

During my career, training and coaching have figured prominently. I have taught at secondary schools in the Netherlands and D.R. Congo and was involved in the training programs of Biology teachers developing curricula for Secondary Schools. I also developed training materials and courses for extension workers in a HIV/AIDS awareness building programme in Mozambique. In Cambodia I worked as a team coordinator of short term teams for an NGO. 

Objective:
Helping people from other cultures and language areas more easily integrate in the Dutch society by teaching them language  and participation skills.

Specialties: "Inburgering, Staatsexamen, Alfabetisering, Participatie. Zorg en Welzijn"
